title: Canada’s new prime minister once said Bitcoin had ‘serious deficiencies’
content: The Liberal Party of Canada has announced Canada’s new prime minister is Mark Carney, a former central banker and Bitcoin critic with plans to fight back against the US’ recently introduced tariffs. Carney won on March 9 in a landslide vote to choose the replacement for Justin Trudeau, who held the position for over seven years. Carney served as governor of the Bank of Canada between 2008 and 2013 before crossing the Atlantic Ocean to serve as governor of the Bank of England for the next seven years. He told local media on March 1 that had he started the process of renouncing his UK and Irish citizenships. Source: Liberal Party of Canada He has opposed Bitcoin ( BTC ) since at least March 2, 2018, when he said Bitcoin’s fixed-supply cap results in “serious deficiencies.” “If ‘those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it,’ recreating a virtual global gold standard would be a criminal act of monetary amnesia.” “The fixed supply of Bitcoin has fed a global speculative mania that has encouraged a proliferation of new cryptocurrencies,” Carney said during his speech on the future of money while serving as governor at England’s top bank. Carney also said Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies had proven to be “poor short-term stores of value.” “If you had taken out a 1,000 pound student loan in Bitcoin in last December to pay your sterling living costs for next year, you’d be short about 500 pounds right now. If you’d done the same last September, you’d be ahead by 2,000 pounds. That’s quite a lottery.” In the same paper, Carney championed central bank digital currencies, stating that they could expand banking access to more individuals and businesses while suggesting it could help central banks “fight terrorism and economic crime.” However, Carney was also a board member at payments processor firm Stripe from February 2021 to January 2025. During that time, Stripe implemented a range of crypto payment solutions between 2022 and 2024. Carney’s negative views on Bitcoin and crypto appear to be even stronger than Trudeau’s, who once described opposition leader Pierre Pollievere’s pro-crypto platform as “reckless.” ”Telling people they can opt out of inflation by investing in cryptocurrencies is not responsible leadership,” Trudeau said in September 2022. Carney plans to fight back at Trump over tariffs In his March 9 victory speech, Carney called out US President Donald Trump for “attacking Canadian families” and attempting to weaken Canada’s economy through tariffs . “Donald Trump has put unjustified tariffs on what we build, sell and how we make a living,” Carney said. Related: A third of central banks cool on launching CBDCs over regulatory concerns The Canadian government has “rightly retaliated” with tariffs, which Carney said will remain in place until “the Americans show us respect.” Mark Carney speaking at his March 9 victory speech. Source: Cable Public Affairs Channel He added that Canada “will never be part of America in any way, shape, or form” — another comment in response to Trump’s aspiration to make Canada the 51st US state. Magazine: Trump’s crypto ventures raise conflict of interest, insider trading questions

title: SHOCKING Crypto Analyst Exposes Market Maker Scheme Linked to Chinese Firm & Binance Listings
content: In a stunning revelation that has sent ripples across the crypto sphere, a prominent crypto analyst has brought to light a potentially damaging connection involving market making practices. The spotlight is on GoPlus (GPS) and MyShell (SHELL), two crypto projects, and their alleged market maker , which is now linked to a Chinese firm named Whisper. This explosive claim, initially shared by crypto analyst AB Kuai.Dong (@_FORAB) on X, quickly gained momentum after being amplified by none other than Binance co-founder Changpeng Zhao (CZ). Let’s dive into the details of this unfolding story and understand what it means for the crypto community. Unveiling the Market Maker Mystery: Who is Whisper? The core of this controversy revolves around Whisper, identified as the market maker for GoPlus (GPS) and MyShell (SHELL). According to the whistleblower, AB Kuai.Dong, the connection to Whisper isn’t just coincidental; it’s allegedly part of a structured system designed to benefit certain entities at the expense of the broader crypto ecosystem. But who exactly is Whisper, and what’s their role in this alleged scheme? Whisper as a Market Maker: In the crypto world, market makers play a crucial role in providing liquidity to trading pairs. They ensure that there are always buyers and sellers available, leading to smoother trading and price discovery. However, the analyst’s claims suggest that Whisper may have been operating in a way that deviates from these standard practices. The Chinese Firm Link: The most concerning aspect of this revelation is Whisper’s alleged connection to a Chinese firm. While the exact nature of this connection is still under scrutiny, it raises questions about potential conflicts of interest and the flow of funds within the crypto space. CZ’s Amplification: When Changpeng Zhao (CZ), a highly influential figure in the crypto world and co-founder of Binance , reposts such claims, it adds significant weight to the allegations and signals that the issue is being taken seriously at the highest levels. This link to a Chinese firm raises eyebrows and warrants a closer look at the entities involved in this intricate web. The Key Players: May Liu, Spark Digital Capital, and Web3Port The whistleblower’s thread points to May Liu, co-founder of Spark Digital Capital, a crypto venture capital firm, as a central figure in this alleged market maker controversy. To understand the allegations, we need to examine the roles of Spark Digital Capital and Web3Port in this ecosystem. Spark Digital Capital: As a crypto venture capital firm, Spark Digital Capital invests in promising crypto projects. May Liu’s role as co-founder places her at the heart of project selection and funding decisions. Web3Port: In a bid to gain a competitive edge in the VC landscape, May Liu reportedly established Web3Port as an incubator. This platform offered early-stage crypto projects consulting, branding, and crucial VC connections. In return, Web3Port allegedly secured 1-3% of the incubated projects’ token supplies. This model itself isn’t inherently problematic, but the subsequent steps are where the allegations arise. Whisper’s Role in Token Liquidation: Here’s where Whisper comes back into the picture. According to the whistleblower, Whisper was launched as a market maker specifically to offload the tokens acquired by Web3Port from incubated projects. This creates a closed-loop system, from incubation to token liquidation, allegedly designed for profit maximization. This structure, encompassing Spark Digital Capital, Web3Port, and Whisper, paints a picture of a potentially streamlined operation aimed at rapidly moving projects towards Binance listings and subsequent token sales. Fast-Tracking to Binance Listings: How Did it Allegedly Work? The allegations suggest that this intricate system was designed to expedite the process of getting projects listed on major exchanges like Binance . While the whistleblower explicitly states that there is no evidence of Binance insiders being involved or bribery taking place, the speed and efficiency of this alleged process are noteworthy. How could such a system operate, and what are the potential implications? The Alleged Closed-Loop Pipeline: Let’s break down the alleged pipeline to understand how it might have functioned: Project Incubation via Web3Port: Promising early-stage crypto projects are identified and brought into the Web3Port incubator. Token Acquisition: Web3Port secures a percentage (1-3%) of the project’s token supply in exchange for services. Market Making by Whisper: Whisper is deployed as the market maker for the incubated project’s token once it’s launched and listed on exchanges. Token Offloading: Whisper then allegedly offloads the acquired tokens into the market, potentially generating profits for those involved in the system. Binance Listing (Target): The ultimate goal, it’s implied, was to fast-track projects towards listings on major exchanges like Binance , where higher trading volumes and liquidity could maximize token sale potential. This alleged system raises serious questions about transparency and fairness within the crypto project launch and listing process. Binance’s Swift Action: Suspension and Compensation In a reassuring turn of events, Binance demonstrated its commitment to user protection by taking swift action upon discovering these alleged irregularities. Binance announced on its official website that it had suspended the accounts of the market maker associated with GPS and SHELL. Furthermore, and crucially for affected users, Binance confiscated the proceeds from these accounts. These confiscated funds are earmarked for compensating users who may have been negatively impacted by the alleged scheme. Key Takeaways from Binance’s Response: Prompt Suspension: Binance acted quickly to suspend the market maker accounts once the issue came to light. This rapid response is crucial in mitigating potential further damage. Confiscation of Proceeds: Confiscating the proceeds sends a strong message that such practices will not be tolerated on the Binance platform. User Compensation: The commitment to compensate affected users is a significant step in restoring trust and demonstrating Binance’s dedication to its community. This is a powerful example of how exchanges can act to protect users in the face of potential market manipulation or unfair practices. Internal Investigation: The whistleblower highlights that Binance’s own internal investigation was instrumental in uncovering this scheme. This underscores the importance of robust internal monitoring and compliance mechanisms within crypto exchanges. What Does This Mean for the Crypto Community? This unfolding story serves as a stark reminder of the complexities and potential pitfalls within the cryptocurrency ecosystem. While the details are still emerging, and investigations are likely ongoing, there are several key takeaways for the crypto community to consider: Actionable Insights and Lessons Learned: Due Diligence is Paramount: For investors, this situation underscores the critical importance of conducting thorough due diligence before investing in any crypto project. Understanding the project’s backers, advisors, and market maker is crucial. Transparency in Market Making: The role of market makers needs greater transparency. The crypto community should advocate for more clarity around market maker operations and potential conflicts of interest. Exchange Vigilance: This incident highlights the need for exchanges like Binance to maintain robust surveillance and internal investigation capabilities to detect and address potentially harmful market practices. Binance’s quick response in this case is commendable and sets a positive precedent. Whistleblower Importance: The role of whistleblowers like AB Kuai.Dong is vital in uncovering hidden issues within the crypto space. Creating a culture that encourages and protects whistleblowers is essential for maintaining integrity. Continued Scrutiny: The crypto community must continue to scrutinize project launches, market maker activities, and exchange listing processes to ensure fairness and prevent similar incidents in the future. Conclusion: A Wake-Up Call for Crypto Transparency The revelations surrounding the alleged market maker scheme involving GoPlus (GPS), MyShell (SHELL), Whisper, and the broader ecosystem of Spark Digital Capital and Web3Port serve as a significant wake-up call for the crypto industry. While Binance’s prompt action to suspend accounts and compensate users is a positive sign, the incident underscores the ongoing need for greater transparency, vigilance, and ethical practices within the crypto space. As investigations continue and more details emerge, the crypto community must learn from this episode and work towards building a more robust and trustworthy ecosystem. The focus should remain on fostering fair markets, protecting users, and ensuring that the innovative potential of cryptocurrencies is not undermined by opaque practices and potential conflicts of interest. The swift response from Binance is a step in the right direction, but sustained effort from all stakeholders is needed to safeguard the future of crypto. To learn more about the latest crypto analyst insights and market maker trends, explore our article on key developments shaping the crypto market and Binance ecosystem.

title: Soaring BTC on Sui: Milestone of 1,000 Unlocks Explosive DeFi Growth!
content: Hold onto your hats, crypto enthusiasts! The Sui blockchain is buzzing with exciting news that signals a significant leap forward for Bitcoin in the decentralized finance (DeFi) realm. Sui recently announced on X that the amount of Bitcoin bridged onto its network has soared past the 1,000 mark. This isn’t just a number; it’s a testament to the growing momentum and potential of BTCfi – Bitcoin finance – within the dynamic Sui ecosystem. Let’s dive into what this milestone means and why it’s generating such excitement. Decoding the Buzz: What is BTC on Sui and BTCfi? Before we get carried away with the celebration, let’s break down what “BTC on Sui” and “BTCfi” actually represent. Essentially, “BTC on Sui” refers to Bitcoin that has been bridged or wrapped to be used on the Sui blockchain. This allows users to utilize their Bitcoin holdings within the Sui network’s DeFi applications. BTCfi , short for Bitcoin finance, is the concept of bringing Bitcoin into the world of DeFi. Traditionally, Bitcoin, while the king of cryptocurrencies, has been somewhat limited in its utility within DeFi ecosystems, which are largely dominated by Ethereum and other smart contract platforms. BTCfi aims to change this by unlocking Bitcoin’s massive liquidity and integrating it into various DeFi protocols, including lending, borrowing, trading, and yield farming. Think of it as giving Bitcoin a new playground where it can earn yield and participate in the innovative financial instruments that DeFi offers. Why is “Bitcoin on Sui” Surpassing 1,000 a Big Deal? Crossing the 1,000 BTC mark on Sui is more than just a vanity metric. It signifies several crucial developments: Growing Adoption of Sui: It clearly indicates increasing confidence and adoption of the Sui blockchain. Developers and users are finding value in Sui’s architecture, speed, and scalability, making it an attractive platform for building and utilizing DeFi applications. Expanding BTCfi Ecosystem: This milestone highlights the expanding landscape of BTCfi. As more Bitcoin flows into Sui, it fuels the growth of DeFi protocols built around Bitcoin, creating more opportunities for users to earn yield and engage with their BTC in novel ways. Liquidity Boost for Sui DeFi: The influx of Bitcoin provides a significant liquidity boost to the Sui DeFi ecosystem. Liquidity is the lifeblood of DeFi, enabling smoother trading, lending, and borrowing activities. More BTC on Sui means a more robust and efficient DeFi environment. Validation of Cross-Chain Interoperability: The success of bridging BTC to Sui demonstrates the growing maturity and effectiveness of cross-chain technologies. It shows that moving assets between different blockchains is becoming increasingly seamless and reliable, paving the way for a more interconnected crypto ecosystem. Unpacking the Benefits of BTCfi on Sui What exactly makes BTCfi on Sui so appealing? Let’s explore the key advantages: Benefit Description Yield Generation for Bitcoin Holders Traditionally, holding Bitcoin has primarily been about price appreciation. BTCfi opens up avenues for Bitcoin holders to earn passive income through lending, staking, and yield farming within the Sui DeFi ecosystem. Diversification of DeFi Opportunities DeFi has largely been Ethereum-centric. BTCfi on Sui diversifies the DeFi landscape by bringing the largest cryptocurrency into the mix, offering users a broader range of assets and opportunities within DeFi. Enhanced Utility of Bitcoin BTCfi expands the utility of Bitcoin beyond just a store of value or a medium of exchange. It transforms Bitcoin into a productive asset that can actively participate in and benefit from the DeFi revolution. Access to Sui’s High Performance Sui is known for its high transaction speeds and low fees. Utilizing Bitcoin on Sui allows users to experience DeFi transactions with greater efficiency and lower costs compared to some other blockchains. Navigating the Challenges and Considerations of BTCfi While the growth of BTCfi on Sui is undeniably exciting, it’s important to acknowledge the challenges and considerations that come with it: Smart Contract Risks: Interacting with DeFi protocols always carries smart contract risks. Bugs or vulnerabilities in smart contracts could potentially lead to loss of funds. Users should exercise caution and engage with audited and reputable platforms. Bridge Security: Bridging Bitcoin to Sui involves cross-chain technology, which can introduce security risks if not implemented properly. Users should be aware of the security mechanisms of the specific bridge being used and choose reputable bridging solutions. Volatility and Impermanent Loss: DeFi activities, particularly yield farming and liquidity providing, can expose users to volatility and impermanent loss. Understanding these risks is crucial before participating in BTCfi protocols. Regulatory Uncertainty: The regulatory landscape for DeFi and cryptocurrencies is still evolving. Changes in regulations could potentially impact BTCfi and DeFi activities. Examples of BTCfi in Action on Sui The Bitcoin on Sui ecosystem is still in its early stages, but we are already seeing promising examples of BTCfi applications emerging: Decentralized Exchanges (DEXs): DEXs on Sui are enabling the trading of wrapped BTC (wBTC) against other Sui-based assets. This provides liquidity and trading opportunities for BTC holders within the Sui ecosystem. Lending and Borrowing Platforms: Protocols are being developed to allow users to lend and borrow wBTC on Sui. This enables Bitcoin holders to earn interest on their holdings or access liquidity by borrowing against their wBTC. Yield Farming Opportunities: Some platforms are offering yield farming opportunities where users can deposit wBTC and earn rewards in the form of platform tokens or other cryptocurrencies. Actionable Insights: How to Explore BTCfi on Sui Interested in exploring the world of DeFi on Sui with your Bitcoin? Here are some actionable steps you can take: Research Sui DeFi Platforms: Explore the various DeFi platforms and protocols that are being built on Sui. Look for platforms that support BTCfi and offer services like DEXs, lending, and yield farming. Understand Bridging Mechanisms: Learn about the different ways to bridge Bitcoin to Sui. Understand the security implications and choose reputable bridging solutions. Start Small and Test the Waters: If you are new to DeFi or BTCfi, start with small amounts to familiarize yourself with the platforms and processes before committing larger sums. Stay Informed and Educated: The DeFi space is constantly evolving. Stay updated on the latest developments in BTCfi on Sui, security best practices, and potential risks. Engage with the Sui Community: Join Sui community forums and channels to learn from other users, ask questions, and stay informed about new opportunities and developments. Conclusion: The Future is Bright for BTCfi on Sui The milestone of 1,000 Bitcoin on Sui is a powerful signal of the growing synergy between Bitcoin and the DeFi world. It underscores the increasing adoption of Sui as a viable and attractive DeFi platform and highlights the exciting potential of BTCfi to unlock new utility and opportunities for Bitcoin holders. While challenges and risks remain, the momentum is undeniable. As the Sui ecosystem matures and more innovative BTCfi applications emerge, we can expect to see even greater integration of Bitcoin into the decentralized financial landscape. The journey of BTCfi on Sui is just beginning, and it promises to be a thrilling ride for the entire crypto community. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Shocking China Crypto Crackdown: Over 3,000 Prosecuted for Money Laundering in 2024
content: Is the crypto world facing a new wave of regulatory scrutiny? Recent reports from China paint a stark picture of escalating measures against cryptocurrency-related financial crimes. With over 3,000 individuals prosecuted in 2024 alone for money laundering involving digital assets, it’s clear that China’s stance on crypto remains firm and is intensifying. This development sends ripples across the global crypto landscape, prompting serious questions about the future of digital currency regulation and adoption, especially concerning China crypto money laundering . Why is China Doubling Down on Cryptocurrency Prosecution? China’s firm stance against cryptocurrencies is not new, but the scale of prosecutions in 2024 signals a significant escalation. The Supreme People’s Procuratorate’s report highlights a focused effort to combat financial crimes leveraging digital currencies. But what’s driving this intensified crackdown? Several factors are likely at play: Capital Control: China has strict capital controls, and cryptocurrencies can be used to bypass these restrictions, facilitating the outflow of capital. This poses a challenge to the government’s economic management. Financial Stability: Unregulated cryptocurrency markets are perceived as a threat to financial stability. The volatility and decentralized nature of crypto make it difficult to control within traditional financial frameworks. Combating Illegal Activities: Cryptocurrencies, due to their pseudonymous nature, can be attractive for illicit activities such as money laundering, drug trafficking, and fraud. The Chinese government is determined to prevent crypto from becoming a haven for criminals. Technological Sovereignty: China’s push for digital yuan and control over technological advancements may also influence its stance against decentralized cryptocurrencies. This isn’t just about banning trading; it’s a comprehensive effort to eliminate crypto’s role in financial crimes within China’s borders. The sheer number of cryptocurrency prosecution cases underscores the seriousness with which China is tackling this issue. Understanding the Money Laundering Crackdown: What Does 3,000 Prosecutions Mean? The figure of 3,032 prosecutions for money laundering involving crypto in 2024 is not just a number; it represents a significant operational effort. To put this into perspective: Aspect Implication of 3,000+ Prosecutions Scale of Operation Indicates a widespread issue and a large-scale law enforcement response. It’s not isolated incidents, but a systemic problem being addressed. Resource Allocation Significant resources are being directed towards investigating and prosecuting crypto-related financial crimes, showing governmental commitment. Deterrent Effect Aims to deter future crypto-related money laundering activities by sending a strong message about the consequences. Impact on Crypto Users in China Creates a chilling effect, potentially driving legitimate crypto users further underground or out of the Chinese market. This money laundering crackdown isn’t just targeting major criminal organizations; it’s likely encompassing a wide range of individuals involved in facilitating the movement of illicit funds through cryptocurrencies. It reflects a proactive and aggressive approach to preemptively address perceived risks. Crypto Regulation China: A Global Ripple Effect? China’s actions in the realm of crypto regulation China have always had global implications. As a major economic power, China’s policies often set trends and influence regulatory approaches worldwide. This latest crackdown could have several ripple effects: Increased Global Regulatory Scrutiny: Other nations might take cues from China and intensify their own regulatory efforts concerning cryptocurrencies and money laundering. Shift in Crypto Activity: Stricter regulations in China could push crypto-related activities to other jurisdictions with more lenient or unclear regulations. This might lead to a geographical shift in the crypto landscape. Innovation and Compliance: The pressure from regulatory crackdowns could spur innovation in compliance technologies and strategies within the crypto industry to better address money laundering concerns. Market Sentiment: Negative news from China, historically a significant crypto market participant, can impact overall market sentiment and potentially trigger price volatility. The global crypto community is closely watching how other countries will respond to China’s aggressive stance. Will it inspire a wave of stricter regulations, or will it create opportunities for more crypto-friendly nations to attract businesses and innovation? The Dark Side of Digital Currency: China Crypto Crime in Focus The prosecutions highlight the undeniable link between cryptocurrencies and financial crime, specifically China crypto crime . While crypto offers benefits like decentralization and efficiency, its pseudonymous nature can be exploited for illicit purposes. Examples of crypto-related crimes in China likely include: Proceeds from Scams and Fraud: Criminals may use crypto to launder profits from online scams, Ponzi schemes, and other fraudulent activities. Drug Trafficking and Illegal Goods: Cryptocurrencies can facilitate transactions in the illicit drug trade and the sale of other illegal goods and services. Cybercrime and Ransomware: Ransomware attackers often demand payment in cryptocurrencies, making it a preferred method for receiving illicit gains. Tax Evasion and Unreported Income: Crypto can be used to conceal income and assets from tax authorities, although this is a less direct form of money laundering but related to financial crime. Combating these crimes requires a multi-faceted approach, involving not just law enforcement but also technological solutions, international cooperation, and greater awareness among crypto users. Actionable Insights: Navigating the Evolving Regulatory Landscape For individuals and businesses operating in the crypto space, especially those with connections to China or operating globally, these developments offer crucial insights: Enhanced Compliance is Key: Robust KYC (Know Your Customer) and AML (Anti-Money Laundering) practices are no longer optional but essential for crypto businesses to operate responsibly and avoid regulatory scrutiny. Geographical Risk Assessment: Understand the regulatory risks associated with different jurisdictions. China’s example highlights the potential for sudden and stringent crackdowns. Transparency and Auditability: Prioritize transparency in crypto transactions and maintain auditable records to demonstrate compliance and legitimacy. Stay Informed: Continuously monitor regulatory developments in key jurisdictions, including China, to adapt strategies and ensure compliance. The tightening grip on crypto in China serves as a stark reminder that regulatory risks are a significant factor in the digital currency ecosystem. Proactive compliance and a deep understanding of the evolving global regulatory landscape are crucial for navigating this complex environment. Conclusion: A New Era of Crypto Regulation? China’s prosecution of over 3,000 individuals for crypto-related money laundering in 2024 is a watershed moment. It signals a decisive and uncompromising approach to regulating cryptocurrencies and combating their use in financial crimes. While the long-term impacts are still unfolding, this crackdown is likely to influence global regulatory trends and further shape the future of the crypto industry. The message is clear: governments worldwide are increasingly focused on bringing digital currencies under control, and the era of unregulated crypto operations is rapidly closing. The crypto space must adapt, prioritize compliance, and engage proactively with regulators to ensure a sustainable and legitimate future. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Shocking $23.1M Ethereum ETF Outflows: Decoding the Crypto ETF Market Shift
content: Just when the crypto world seemed to be catching its breath, a wave of unexpected activity has hit the U.S. spot Ethereum ETF market. Recent data reveals a significant shift in investor sentiment as these newly launched investment vehicles experienced a notable outflow. Let’s delve into the details of this developing story and understand what’s driving these movements in the rapidly evolving crypto ETF landscape. Are we seeing a temporary blip or the start of a larger trend in Ethereum ETF outflows ? Decoding the $23.1M Ethereum ETF Outflows On March 7th, the U.S. spot Ethereum ETF market witnessed a combined net outflow of $23.1 million. This marks the third consecutive day of net outflows, according to data meticulously tracked by Farside Investors. This figure raises eyebrows, especially considering the initial excitement and inflows surrounding the launch of these ETFs. But where exactly are these outflows originating from? The data points to a concentrated source: withdrawals from two major players in the ETF arena: Fidelity’s FETH : Experienced outflows of $11.9 million. BlackRock’s ETHA : Saw withdrawals totaling $11.2 million. Interestingly, all other spot Ethereum ETFs in the U.S. market reported no change in their holdings during this period. This concentrated outflow suggests specific factors might be influencing investor decisions related to FETH and ETHA. Could this be profit-taking, portfolio rebalancing, or a reaction to broader market sentiments? Spot Ethereum ETF Performance: A Closer Look To truly grasp the significance of these outflows, it’s crucial to understand the context of spot Ethereum ETF performance since their inception. While the recent outflows are noteworthy, it’s essential to look at the bigger picture. Here’s a quick snapshot: Initial Hype and Inflows : Upon launch, spot Ethereum ETFs garnered considerable attention and attracted significant inflows, reflecting pent-up demand for direct Ethereum exposure within traditional investment portfolios. Competitive Landscape : Several issuers entered the market, each vying for market share with slightly different fee structures and marketing approaches. This competition is healthy for investors, but also means fund flows can be more dynamic. Market Volatility : The cryptocurrency market is inherently volatile. Fluctuations in Ethereum’s price and overall market sentiment can directly impact ETF flows. Early Stages : Spot Ethereum ETFs are still relatively new. It’s natural to expect periods of both inflows and outflows as the market matures and investors refine their strategies. Let’s visualize the recent outflows in a simple table: ETF Issuer ETF Ticker Net Outflow (USD Million) Fidelity FETH $11.9 BlackRock ETHA $11.2 Other ETFs – $0.0 Total Net Outflow $23.1 Why the Outflows? Unpacking the Potential Reasons Several factors could be contributing to these crypto ETF market outflows. It’s important to note that pinpointing the exact cause is challenging, but we can explore some plausible explanations: Profit Taking : Investors who entered the market early and saw gains might be taking profits, especially if they anticipate short-term market corrections. Portfolio Rebalancing : Institutional investors and fund managers often rebalance their portfolios periodically. Outflows from Ethereum ETFs could be part of a broader asset allocation strategy. Market Sentiment Shift : While the overall crypto market has been bullish recently, there are always undercurrents of uncertainty. Negative news or concerns about regulatory developments could trigger outflows. Rotation into Other Assets : Investors might be rotating capital into other asset classes, including Bitcoin ETFs, other cryptocurrencies, or even traditional markets, based on perceived opportunities. Specific ETF Dynamics : It’s possible that factors specific to FETH and ETHA, such as fee structures, trading volumes, or investor demographics, are playing a role. Navigating the Crypto ETF Market: What Investors Should Consider For investors navigating the dynamic crypto ETF market , understanding these flows and potential drivers is crucial. Here are some actionable insights: Long-Term Perspective : Focus on the long-term potential of Ethereum and the broader crypto ecosystem rather than reacting to short-term market fluctuations. Diversification : Diversify your crypto investments across different assets and strategies. Don’t put all your eggs in one basket, even within the ETF space. Due Diligence : Thoroughly research different ETF providers, understand their fee structures, and consider factors like tracking error and liquidity. Stay Informed : Keep abreast of market news, regulatory developments, and macroeconomic trends that could impact the crypto market and ETF flows. Risk Management : Understand the risks associated with crypto investments, including volatility and regulatory uncertainty, and invest accordingly. The Future of Ethereum ETFs: A Glimpse Ahead Despite these recent outflows, the long-term outlook for spot Ethereum ETFs remains promising. They offer a regulated and accessible pathway for traditional investors to gain exposure to Ethereum. As the crypto market matures and adoption grows, we can expect continued evolution in the ETF landscape. Here’s what to watch for in the future: Increased Adoption : As awareness and understanding of crypto ETFs increase, broader adoption from institutional and retail investors is likely. Product Innovation : We may see more specialized crypto ETFs emerge, focusing on specific sectors within the crypto ecosystem, such as DeFi or NFTs. Regulatory Clarity : Continued regulatory development will provide greater certainty and potentially unlock further institutional investment. Market Maturation : As the market matures, we can expect to see more stable and predictable ETF flows, though volatility will likely remain a factor. Conclusion: Embracing the Evolving Crypto ETF Landscape The recent $23.1 million outflow from U.S. spot Ethereum ETFs serves as a reminder that the crypto ETF market is still in its early innings and subject to market dynamics. While these outflows warrant attention, they don’t necessarily signal a fundamental shift in the long-term trajectory of Ethereum ETFs. For investors, the key is to stay informed, maintain a long-term perspective, and navigate this exciting, yet volatile, space with careful consideration and due diligence. The crypto ETF journey is just beginning, and there’s much more to unfold in the years to come. To learn more about the latest crypto ETF market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Ethereum institutional adoption.

title: Bitcoin Price In Limbo—Consolidating Below $92K Ahead of Next Move
content: Bitcoin price started a recovery wave from the $85,000 zone. BTC is back above $87,500 and might struggle to clear the $92,000 resistance zone. Bitcoin started a fresh upward move from the $85,000 zone. The price is trading below $90,000 and the 100 hourly Simple moving average. There is a short-term contracting triangle forming with resistance at $89,650 on the hourly chart of the BTC/USD pair (data feed from Kraken). The pair could start another decline if it fails to clear the $92,000 resistance zone. Bitcoin Price Faces Resistance Bitcoin price started a fresh decline below the $90,000 level. BTC traded below the $88,000 and $87,000 support levels . Finally, the price tested the $85,000 support zone. A low was formed at $84,665 and the price recently started a recovery wave. There was a move above the $86,000 and $87,000 resistance levels. The bulls pushed the price toward the 50% Fib retracement level of the downward move from the $92,741 swing high to the $84,665 low. Bitcoin price is now trading below $90,000 and the 100 hourly Simple moving average . On the upside, immediate resistance is near the $88,700 level. The first key resistance is near the $90,000 level. There is also a short-term contracting triangle forming with resistance at $89,650 on the hourly chart of the BTC/USD pair. It is close to the 61.8% Fib retracement level of the downward move from the $92,741 swing high to the $84,665 low. The next key resistance could be $92,000. A close above the $92,000 resistance might send the price further higher. In the stated case, the price could rise and test the $93,500 resistance level. Immediate support on the downside is near the $87,000 level. The first major support is near the $86,200 level. The next support is now near the $85,000 zone. Any more losses might send the price toward the $82,000 support in the near term. The main support sits at $80,000. Technical indicators: Hourly MACD – The MACD is now losing pace in the bullish zone. Hourly RSI (Relative Strength Index) – The RSI for BTC/USD is now below the 50 level. Major Support Levels – $87,000, followed by $85,000. Major Resistance Levels – $90,000 and $92,000.

title: Shiba Inu Stuck In a Downtrend – SHIB Price Collapse Coming?
content: Shiba Inu (SHIB) bulls are nervously prodding the price higher early on Thursday as traders await Friday’s highly anticipated White House crypto summit that could reveal the launch of a US strategic Bitcoin reserve. There is currently a 67% chance that Trump creates a National Bitcoin Reserve this year. That is near the all-time highest odds we have seen. MARKET: https://t.co/lIOOfQEPqp pic.twitter.com/mUNLxVnCdB — Anthony Pompliano (@APompliano) March 6, 2025 The Shiba Inu price was last around $0.0000135, modestly higher on the session and up over 10% from Tuesday’s lows. The meme coin continues to trade around 60% down from its December 2024 highs in the $0.000033 area. As market leading crypto Bitcoin gears up for a potential rush back to record highs, could the meme coin market also be ready for an over-due rebound? Possibly, but Shiba Inu has some major technical hurdles to get past first before it would be safe to conclude that the downtrend is over. Shiba Inu Price Prediction – Where Next? Shiba Inu’s 21DMA has offered stiff resistance on multiple occasions over the last few weeks, a strong signal that the bears have been in control of this market. Just looking at the Shiba Inu chart alone, there is nothing really to suggest that a rebound is coming. Rather, pressure appears to be building towards a potential breakout below support in the $0.000011-12 area. A break below here would open the door to a drop potentially all the way back towards 2023 lows in the $0.000006 area, a nightmare scenario for Shiba Inu investors. However, with US President Trump delaying tariffs on Canada and Mexico once again, and Friday’s US crypto announcement coming, the mood might continue improving in the coming days. “We are going to give a one month exemption on any autos coming through USMCA,” White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said, referring to the trade deal Trump negotiated with Canada and Mexico in his first term https://t.co/F2HuWeUQsN pic.twitter.com/qwaL8FfGnF — Bloomberg TV (@BloombergTV) March 5, 2025 This could be enough to save Shiba Inu in the short term. But Shiba Inu won’t be out of the woods until it can mount a breakout of its current downtrend. And, even if major cryptos surge on Friday, there is no guarantee that this materializes. Much of the market appears to have become demoralized with the meme coin space, and the next leg of the crypto bull market might be time for utility plays to shine. Sure, Shiba Inu is trying to build its own web3 ecosystem. But no one really takes it seriously beyond being just a meme coin. Is SHIB a Good Crypto to Buy Now? Of course, moments when FUD is high are almost always the best times to buy a crypto, and FUD is certainly high in the meme coin space right now. Meme coins may are likely to have a more difficult year in 2025 than 2024, with focus on other sectors of the crypto market (like Bitcoin ). But it would be crazy to suggest that meme coins like Shiba Inu are “dead”. Indeed, for investors looking to gain some exposure to the high risk meme coin space, SHIB remains a great option. Maybe it’s not the best crypto to buy right now. But SHIB arguably still deserves consideration in any crypto investor’s portfolio. The post Shiba Inu Stuck In a Downtrend – SHIB Price Collapse Coming? appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: ETH Tests $2K, Lowest Since November 2023
description: $165 million in long ETH positions have been liquidated in the last 12 hours.
content:
Ether (ETH) is testing levels not seen since November 2023, as the market continues to be hit by volatility resulting from U.S. President Donald Trump's trade war threat. 

ETH is down 15% in the last 24 hours, according to CoinDesk Indices data, dragging down the CoinDesk 20, a measure of the largest digital assets, which is down 16%. 

Ether's decline over the past three months has been driven by bearish investor sentiment, reflected in its underperformance relative to BTC and weak institutional demand, alongside macro headwinds like trade war fears, inflation concerns, and stock market weakness, which have dampened risk appetite.

CoinGlass data shows that nearly $165 million in ETH long positions have been liquidated in the last 12 hours.  

Bettors on Polymarket are giving a 76% chance of ether hitting $1900 by the end of the month. 

Ether ETF outflows were significantly negative last week, totaling -$335 million, according to data from SoSoValue.

title: President Trump doesn’t like Wall Street very much anymore
content: Donald Trump loved the stock market when it worked in his favor. During his first term, he made sure everyone knew when the S&P 500 hit new highs. But things have changed. Since returning to the White House in January, the president has been unusually quiet about Wall Street, even when the market briefly hit a record on February 19. Now? The S&P 500 has fallen almost every day, sinking below the level it was at when he took office in January. Other indexes tied to the real economy are sliding, and Bitcoin, which once rode the Trump wave, has dropped 20% in a month. Markets react as investor confidence tumbles Stocks are moving differently than they did in Trump’s first term. In 2017, the economy was still recovering from an energy crisis, and interest rates were four percentage points lower than they are now. The Federal Reserve was trying to pump life into the markets, and when Trump unleashed tax cuts, stocks took off. The S&P 500 saw two consecutive years of more than 20% growth in 2023 and 2024—the first time that had happened since 1996. But markets can’t keep climbing forever. Now, valuations are sky-high, and the stocks that fueled the last rally aren’t pulling their weight. The Magnificent Seven, the elite group of AI-driven tech stocks that have dominated markets, make up about a third of the S&P 500’s total value. But they’re no longer pushing things upward. Nvidia, the AI chip powerhouse, has dropped nearly 10% since Trump’s inauguration. Only two out of 11 sectors in the S&P 500 are in the red this year, and tech is one of them. Trump’s new tariffs shake global markets Andrew Brenner, head of international fixed income at National Alliance Securities, summed up the mood among traders. “The tariff rhetoric has become daily and extreme, sentiment is awful and trading is on edge.” On Thursday, Trump reignited trade war fears by announcing a new 10% tariff on Chinese imports, set to take effect on March 4, and also confirmed plans for tariffs on Canada and Mexico, keeping investors on edge about future trade disputes. The Nasdaq, which is heavy with tech stocks, has already lost 4% this month. European markets felt the pressure too. Germany’s DAX and the Stoxx Europe 600 opened lower on the news, while Japan’s Nikkei 225 dropped 2.9%, South Korea’s Kospi fell 3.4%, and Hong Kong’s Hang Seng index slid 3.3%. Even China’s CSI 300 benchmark lost 2%. Almost 90 percent of survey respondents said that stocks are overvalued. The CBOE Skew Index, which measures how much investors are girding for a sell-off by tracking trades in options markets that would buffer against a sudden plunge in the value of the S&P 500, reached its highest level ever on February 18, the day before that index hit its record high. The Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta revised its first-quarter GDP forecast, now expecting the U.S. economy to shrink by 1.5%. That’s a sharp turnaround from its previous forecast of 2.3% growth just two weeks ago. Trump’s economic policies are already having a measurable impact, and traders are scrambling to adjust. Late rally gives temporary relief, but concerns are still there Friday brought some relief to the markets. The S&P 500 closed 1.6% higher, cutting its February decline to 1.4%. The Nasdaq also rose 1.6%. Nvidia rebounded 4% after an 8.4% drop on Thursday, though its recent losses have raised questions about the strength of the AI boom. European markets recovered as well. Germany’s DAX and the Stoxx Europe 600 ended the day flat, regaining earlier losses. Then on Friday, during a tense Oval meeting, Trump accused Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskyy of “gambling with World War Three,” then chastised him and kicked him out of the White House, canceling their economic partnership and the joint press conference they had planned later in the day. Later on Truth Social, Trump said , “We had a very meaningful meeting in the White House today. Much was learned that could never be understood without conversation under such fire and pressure. It’s amazing what comes out through emotion, and I have determined that President Zelenskyy is not ready for Peace if America is involved, because he feels our involvement gives him a big advantage in negotiations. I don’t want advantage, I want PEACE. He disrespected the United States of America in its cherished Oval Office. He can come back when he is ready for Peace.” Despite everything, Trump told supporters in Miami on February 19, “I think the stock market’s going to be great.” But he also exaggerated the numbers, claiming the Dow had jumped 10% since his election when the actual increase was less than 7%. The S&P 500 surged by 6.25% between election night (November 5) and February 19, but now it’s up by only 3% since November 5. Cryptopolitan Academy: Want to grow your money in 2025? Learn how to do it with DeFi in our upcoming webclass. Save Your Spot

title: Elon Musk goes on Joe Rogan, mockingly asks Grok if there is any gold left in Fort Knox
content: Elon Musk, now deeply embedded in the U.S. government, sat down with Joe Rogan for a three-hour conversation on Friday night, touching on everything from government fraud to AI. But things went off the rails when mid-discussion, Elon told Rogan to ask Grok—his AI chatbot—whether there was any gold left in Fort Knox. “Are you a f—— conspiracy theorist?” Grok shot back. Rogan laughed, Elon smirked, and the internet exploded with hilarious memes. The “Is the gold still there?” question has been floating around for a few weeks now, and Elon has even shown his openness to replacing the gold with Bitcoin, as Cryptopolitan reported last month. That was just one of the many bizarre, headline-grabbing moments from the interview, which covered everything from Elon’s role in Trump’s administration to unverified claims of rampant fraud in federal agencies. Elon, as usual, came armed with big statements, vague details, and no shortage of controversy. Elon dodges specifics on DOGE’s government cuts Elon’s Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) has been slashing its way through federal agencies, but exactly how it operates remains a mystery. Rogan pushed Elon for details, but he dodged specifics. “These are cuts that DOGE recommends to the department,” Elon said. “Usually these recommendations are followed, but these are recommendations that are then confirmed by the department.” The exact number of DOGE employees? Unclear. Elon said the team started with 40 to 100 people but didn’t specify how large it has grown. Some reports suggest the workforce has expanded significantly. Congress and federal officials have raised serious concerns about DOGE’s hiring process, which has brought in staff as young as 19. DOGE’s access to federal data has also triggered nearly a dozen lawsuits. Elon defended the agency’s vetting process, insisting that “anyone from DOGE has to go through the same vetting process that those federal employees went through.” He added , “If for example there’s a security clearance needed, the DOGE person has to have that same security clearance, so there’s no reduction in security.” Fraud claims, missing gold theories, and social security chaos Elon doubled down on claims that fraud is running rampant in Social Security. He told Rogan that DOGE found “20 million dead people marked as alive” in the system. Rogan asked if those people were actually receiving benefits. Elon’s response? “Yes.” But when pressed for specifics—like what percentage of those 20 million were actually getting money—Elon didn’t have an answer. Social Security’s acting commissioner, Lee Dudek, later pushed back on Elon’s claims. “The reported data are people in our records with a Social Security number who do not have a date of death associated with their record. These individuals are not necessarily receiving benefits,” Dudek said . Elon then pivoted to FEMA, claiming the agency spent $59 million on migrant housing. A few days earlier, Elon had posted the same claim on X, crediting DOGE with uncovering the spending. But the funding had already been made public and approved by Congress. Despite this, four FEMA officials were fired the day after Elon’s post. The officials were reportedly tied to hotel funding for migrants in New York City. Then came the Fort Knox moment. Elon talks Trump, secret tech, and the Nazi controversy Though the administration has said that Elon is a White House advisor, President Donald Trump has said that Elon is leading the way with DOGE’s efforts to slash the federal government. At Trump’s first Cabinet meeting Wednesday, Elon had an outsized role, with Trump giving him the floor for a large chunk of it. “This is a revolutionary Cabinet and maybe the most revolutionary Cabinet since the first revolution,” Elon said. The conversation then shifted to secret technology. Elon, who has long pushed for transparency in space tech, was asked whether private contractors were hiding advanced propulsion technology. “I don’t think they’re hiding it from me,” Elon said, implying he’d know if they were. He didn’t expand on the subject, leaving plenty of room for speculation. One of the more heated moments came when Rogan brought up a recent controversy. During Trump’s inauguration celebration, Elon made a gesture that some compared to a Nazi salute. The legacy media latched onto the moment, especially after Elon followed it up by posting Nazi-related puns on X. Elon denied any wrongdoing. “It was obviously meant in the most positive spirit possible,” Elon told Rogan. “Now I can never point at things diagonally.” He went further, accusing the media of deliberately twisting the story. “It’s deliberate propaganda,” Elon said. “They know it was obviously not meant in a negative way. I’d literally said, ‘my heart goes out to you.’ It was very positive. My entire speech was very positive.” Despite the backlash, Elon refused to back down. The controversy has only added to the growing political storm surrounding his government role. Cryptopolitan Academy: Tired of market swings? Learn how DeFi can help you build steady passive income. Register Now

title: Two Big Whales are on the Move After Recent Developments in This Altcoin: They Moved a Large Amount of Coins from the Exchange to Their Cold Wallets
content: Two major Solana (SOL) whales withdrew over 95,000 SOL from Binance in the space of two hours, according to on-chain data from Lookonchain. The withdrawals came after a major announcement by CME Group regarding Solana futures trading. According to Lookonchain observations: The AHdUMw…qMnj wallet withdrew 54,544 SOL (approximately $7.46 million) from Binance two hours ago. The 7i6FUR…kp5J wallet withdrew 41,096 SOL (approximately $6.96 million) from Binance an hour ago. The whale activity appears to be a reaction to CME Group’s announcement that it plans to launch futures contracts on Solana on March 17, 2025. CME, a leading global derivatives market, plans to launch two types of Solana futures contracts: A standard contract representing 500 SOL. A micro-scale contract representing 25 SOLs. “We are responding to increasing client demand for a broader set of regulated products to manage cryptocurrency price risk,” said Giovanni Vicioso, Global Head of Cryptocurrency Products at CME. Related News: Chinese Company Can't Keep Up With Demand for Mining Devices in This Altcoin After Trump Wins Election If approved, the launch of Solana futures could pave the way for Solana-related exchange-traded funds (ETFs). Firms such as VanEck, 21Shares and Franklin Templeton have already filed for spot Solana ETFs with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), with the earliest filings set for June 2024. Industry experts suggest the SEC may want to observe several months of trading activity in a regulated Solana futures market before granting ETF approvals. The launch of CME’s futures contracts “significantly increases” the likelihood of ETF approval, said Sui Chung, CEO of CF Benchmarks. Nate Geraci, President of The ETF Store, noted that CME’s Solana futures will be cash-settled, which is seen as a positive factor for ETF applications. The futures will be based on the CME CF Solana USD Reference Rate, which is used as the reference for daily SOL/USD pricing and is calculated each day at 4:00 p.m. London time. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Two Big Whales are on the Move After Recent Developments in This Altcoin: They Moved a Large Amount of Coins from the Exchange to Their Cold Wallets

title: Market Jitters: Bitcoin Dives, $80K Breakout in Jeopardy
content: Bitcoin price started a fresh decline below the $85,000 support. BTC must stay above the $80,000 zone to avoid more losses in the near term. Bitcoin started a fresh decline from the $86,500 zone. The price is trading below $82,500 and the 100 hourly Simple moving average. There is a connecting bearish trend line forming with resistance at $83,800 on the hourly chart of the BTC/USD pair (data feed from Kraken). The pair could start another decline if it fails to stay above the $85,000 zone. Bitcoin Price Dips Sharply Bitcoin price failed to stay above the $88,500 level and started a fresh decline . BTC declined heavily below the $86,500 and $85,000 support levels. The price even dived below the $82,000 level. It tested the $80,000 zone. A low was formed at $80,000 and the price is now consolidating losses. It is showing many bearish signs below the 23.6% Fib retracement level of the downward wave from the $86,934 swing high to the $80,000 low. Bitcoin price is now trading below $82,200 and the 100 hourly Simple moving average . On the upside, immediate resistance is near the $81,650 level. The first key resistance is near the $83,500 level or the 50% Fib retracement level of the downward wave from the $86,934 swing high to the $80,000 low. There is also a connecting bearish trend line forming with resistance at $83,800 on the hourly chart of the BTC/USD pair. The next key resistance could be $85,000. A close above the $85,000 resistance might send the price further higher. In the stated case, the price could rise and test the $86,500 resistance level. Any more gains might send the price toward the $88,000 level or even $88,500. More Losses In BTC? If Bitcoin fails to rise above the $85,000 resistance zone, it could start a fresh decline. Immediate support on the downside is near the $80,000 level. The first major support is near the $78,500 level. The next support is now near the $76,200 zone. Any more losses might send the price toward the $75,000 support in the near term. The main support sits at $73,500. Technical indicators: Hourly MACD – The MACD is now gaining pace in the bearish zone. Hourly RSI (Relative Strength Index) – The RSI for BTC/USD is now below the 50 level. Major Support Levels – $80,000, followed by $78,500. Major Resistance Levels – $83,800 and $85,000.
